results.name: default/mysql-767f754784-dzf6l
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "mysql:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check Kubernetes node permissions.
5. Try a specific version tag instead of "latest".

results.name: default/wordpress-5697597cbc-558km
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "wordpress:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull wordpress:latest`.

results.name: default/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-767f754784-dzf6l], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the pod mysql-767f754784-dzf6l is not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs mysql-767f754784-dzf6l`.
3. Verify readiness probe configuration.
4. Ensure dependencies (e.g., DB) are accessible.

results.name: default/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-5697597cbc-558km], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service is not functioning because the expected pod is not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs <pod-name>`.
3. Verify pod readiness probe configuration.
4. Ensure all dependencies are available.
5. Restart pod if necessary.
